channel.title: Report Builder on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Report Builder on 0x000216

item.title: Is it possible to use Report Builder 3.0 without SQL Reporting Services?
item.description: Many people connect SQL Server 2008 R2 Report Builder (Report Builder 3.0) with SQL Server Reporting Services, which makes sense because using Report Builder with SQL Server Reporting Services allows you to share reports you create with others through the Report Manager website. However, many don’t realize that Report Builder 3.0 can function similarly to Crystal Reports, enabling you to create and run reports directly on your desktop without needing SQL Server Reporting Services.
